Ben Lomond

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Ben Lomond is one of the most familiar and popular of the Munros, its fine summit being in clear view from the south end of the Loch at Balloch. Whilst the path is wide and busy up the slopes, the summit is dramatically situated above a steep corrie and the views over the Loch are unsurpassed.

 You have not climbed Ben Lomond.

Region: Loch Lomond

Altitude: 974 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 3.81/5
Rating: 3.8/5 (317 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Ben Lomond from Rowardennan

Other routes and challenges

The route above follows the extremely popular path up the south ridge, before descending via the rougher Ptarmigan ridge. These two routes are by far the most commonly used.

A little-used, pathless and strenuous alternative is from the foot of Loch Chon to the east. Head up to Comer before ascending the south side of the eastern corrie.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Drymen Hotels

Drymen B&B

Drymen Cottages

Loch Lomond Hostels

Panoramic summit view (click to open)





Users' walk reports for Ben Lomond

There are 19378 Walkhighlanders who have climbed Ben Lomond. They have contributed 298 public walk reports including this summit. These are ordered below with the most popular ones first. The rightmost column shows how many summits were included in their report, which may help you to find the most relevant reports.
